page.title: 16EVERTHORPE FARM
page.content: { { }This farm belongs to The Youth Custody Centre. It is worked by the boys under the supervision of the officers. Most of the farms in the area are arable farming, but this farm is mainly livestock. The farm covers 50 acres. There are 50 cows which are all Friesians. It is a milking herd. The calves only have their first 24 hours with their mothers. The calves get used to being handled by humans, this makes them easier to handle when they become larger animals. From April to October the cows eat grass outside. From November to March they eat silage indoors. The silage is made at the farm. The cows are milked for 305 days, and 60 days when they are not milked.
